textBox.richText: We arrived in Marrakesh for Christmas Eve. Right off the plane our local guide Mohamed gave us a tour of the market and the Souk. We left we a toy snake and carpet, Yes, we don’t need a carpet. And definitely not one that cost so much that the guy threw in two free carpets for the kids. But, hey - they are good. We visited the Jardin Marjorelle -- made by a French guy way back and currently maintained by Yves StLaurent who has a house next door. Wonderful. The Souk was a sight to see -- so many people selling the same things. Tourists everywhere. The children were very happy with the snake charmer and the monkey. Everyone here wants you to take his picture (and then pay a few dirhams for the privilege). We ate in a restaurant located on the roof of a Ryad (a small hotel with an inside courtyard). The food was delicious but took over an hour to appear. Not good with two jet lagged kids. The photos are HERE.
